intro: Senecio freemanii, commonly known as the Freeman's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Senecio freemanii is considered a rare and sensitive species.
